```{r}
# Loading necessary library
library(mosaic)
```


```{r q9}

# Question 9
# Create a data frame
UM_data <- data.frame(scores = c(1,4,3.1,5,8,7,6.1,7,8,11.2))

#View the data
print(UM_data)

# Running the one sample t-test with mu = 8 because that's the given population average

t_test(~scores, mu = 8, data = UM_data)

```


```{r q10}

# Checking out the galton dataset

print(Galton)

# Upon exploring the dataset, the variables needed are sex and height.

# Running the two independent samples t-test
t_test(height~sex, data = Galton)


```


```{r q11}

# Checking out the mtcars dataset
?mtcars

# We have mpg -- a numerical variable and am -- a binary variable with 0 meaning automatic and 1 manual.

print(mtcars)

# Running the two indepdent sample t-test

t_test(mpg~am, data = mtcars)
```
